properties.name: prototype
properties.description: `name [ url(...) ]` Name of the class in the script, Such a class can define methods, properties and event handling methods of the whole class of elements this style applies to.

properties.name: aspect
properties.description: `functionName [ url(...) ]` One or list of name/url pairs. functions are called once on initialization.

properties.name: hit-margin
properties.description: defines hover area of the element. Positive values increase hover area and negative values decrease it. Hit margins are calculated from border box of the element.

properties.name: context-menu
properties.description: `selector(#menu) | url(menu.htm)` use custom (right click) context menu

properties.name: scroll-manner
properties.description: `scroll-manner( animation:false, step:auto... )` define scroll animation and behavior.

properties.name: vertical-scrollbar
properties.description: `style-set-name` - style set that defines styles of vertical scrollbar.

properties.name: horizontal-scrollbar
properties.description: `style-set-name` - style set that defines styles of horizontal scrollbar.

properties.name: popup-position
properties.description: `default|top-left|top-center|middle-left|bottom-right`... relative to the element that requested the popup (popup anchor element).

properties.name: flow
properties.description: `vertical|horizontal|vertical-wrap|horizontal-wrap`... direction of child elements in block containers (e.g. DIVs). This attribute defines type of layout manager (LM) used by the block container.

properties.name: flow-columns
properties.description: `<width-def>`... define lists of column size defintions of the grid.

properties.name: flow-rows
properties.description: `<height-def>`... define lists of row size defintions of the grid.

properties.name: border-spacing
properties.description: `10px` Defines spacing between all direct child elements (inter-cell spacing);

properties.name: style-set
properties.description: named block of style rules declarations that are applied to elements DOM sub-tree.

properties.name: foreground
properties.description: has the same set of attributes as background, but is drawn on top of everything.
